dict.acceptation: [乐]音阶，度；[数]度，度数；程度；学位；

sent.orig: Master Degree: a professional degree with requirements including previous bachelor degree and qualifying examinations.
sent.trans: 硕士学位：属于专业学位，就读此类学位需要已经有学士学位和资格认证。

sent.orig: A black woman with a degree earns as much as a white woman with a degree.
sent.trans: 有学位的黑人女性与同类白人女性的工资相同。

sent.orig: Firstly, there aa degree will have an competitive advantage over those with only a bachelor degree.
sent.trans: 首先，人们看法到，在失业协作中，存在硕士学位者比只存在学士学位者存在优势。

sent.orig: At twenty-one he took his degree-a respectable degree, but not a very high one.
sent.trans: 二十一岁他获得了一个不很高，但也令人钦羡的学位。

sent.orig: Bachelor degree; Accounting or English degree, more than 5 years working experience preferred.
sent.trans: 大学本科学历。会计或英文专业、具有5年以上工作经历优先考虑。
